You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Full Refresh of a Cart's Data on the Scaled Cart Page

With a large number of items in a cart, sometimes the price or availability of items throughout the cart can change when the buyer is finally ready to check out. To help ensure the quality of the cart data, the Scaled Cart page requires the buyer to execute a full refresh of the price and availability for all cart items. A buyer can also manually execute a full refresh at any time.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) only

The Scaled Cart page provides the following tools for refreshing the price and availability data for all items in the cart:

Last Refresh (1)
Timestamp that shows the date and time when the cart's prices were most recently refreshed:
The timestamp is first set when a buyer adds a product to the cart for the first time.
The timestamp is updated when a refresh operation completes successfully.
The timestamp shows Last Refresh: Failed when a refresh operation fails.

The date and time shown on the page depends on the buyer's preferred timezone and is formatted using JavaScript, which respects the browser's default date and time formats for different locales. For information about customizing the date and time format for a specific locale, see Localize the Last Refresh Timestamp on the Scaled Cart Page.

Refresh Cart (2)
Button that executes a manual refresh for all items in the cart.
Checkout (3)
Button that navigates to the Checkout page when the cart's price and availability data is current.

After a buyer clicks Refresh Cart (2) or Checkout (3), the refresh begins, but the buyer experience is different depending on your asynchronous processing threshold:

When the number of cart items is less than the asynchronous processing threshold, the refresh logic executes synchronously. The Scaled Cart page automatically updates with the current price and availability data. If no errors occur, the buyer can continue to the Checkout page.
When the number of cart items is equal to or exceeds the asynchronous processing threshold, the buyer is prompted to refresh the price and availability data for all cart items. The buyer can either proceed or cancel and manually click Refresh Cart. The refresh logic executes asynchronously. The Scaled Cart page becomes inactive, except for the Continue Shopping button, and shows the following indications that the refresh operation is in progress:
Refresh icon (4)
Indicates that the refresh operation remains in progress. The icon appears both on the page and on the cart summary in the header.
Refresh message (5)
Explains that the refresh operation remains in progress.
Subtotal (6)
Shows a temporary value of Repricing until the refresh operation completes.

After the refresh operation completes, the Scaled Cart page becomes active again, and shows a message that indicates whether the refresh succeeded or failed. If cart items are no longer available after the refresh completes, the Scaled Cart page provides tools for the buyer to remove unavailable products.

NOTE
B2B Commerce for Visualforce doesn't provide any configuration options for these default behaviors.
If your storefront uses the Mini Cart widget, the widget shows only the total number of items and cart subtotal from the most recent successful refresh operation. During a cart refresh, a buyer can’t interact with the Mini Cart widget.
In the My Carts section of the My Account page, a buyer can't perform any action on the cart during a refresh. The cart's status shows Active (Refreshing), and the subtotal amount isn't available.
